stlib.datatypes.unit.spatial

Class UnitRegionConst

  • java.lang.Object
    • stlib.datatypes.GeneralType
      • stlib.datatypes.unit.UnitObject<RegionIF>
        • stlib.datatypes.unit.spatial.UnitRegionConst
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<UnitObjectIF<RegionIF>>, MovableSpatial, GeneralTypeIF, UnitRegionIF, UnitObjectConstIF<RegionIF>, UnitObjectIF<RegionIF>

    public class UnitRegionConst
extends UnitObject<RegionIF>
implements UnitRegionIF, UnitObjectConstIF<RegionIF>
    This class represents 'UnitRegionConst' objects and is used for 'MovingRegion' objects with a constant location over a certain period of time.
    Author:
    Markus Fuessel

      With ignoreClosedFlags set to true the interval is considered as closed.

      • getValue

        public RegionIF getValue(TimeInstantIF instant,
                         boolean ignoreClosedFlags)
        Description copied from interface: UnitObjectIF
        This method returns a object of type T which is valid at the given time instant, if this time instant lies inside the defined period of this unitobject
        With ignoreClosedFlags set to true the interval is considered as closed.

        otherwise the returned object is undefined

        Specified by:
        getValue in interface UnitObjectIF<RegionIF>
        Parameters:
        instant - the time instant
        ignoreClosedFlags - - the left closed and right closed flags are ignored if true
        Returns:
        object of type T
